data.title: Great Food Great Atmosphere!
data.text: If you're a brown liquor guy or gal this is the place for you. They must have hundreds of bourbon Rye whiskey scotch selections. Food is very good as well.The hamburgers were delicious and prepared perfectly. Spicy hush puppies where to die for the gumbo with Andueulle  sausage were excellent. The prices were right. Give it a try I'll be back

data.title: Food was good
data.text: We went there with a large group.  Not recommended.  But, the food was good.   The service was excellent.  Would go back, but just not as a large group.

data.title: First Class Whiskey Bar
data.text: First class whiskey bar with full drink menu and great food menu.  We've had sliders, gumbo, boudin balls ... and all were excellent.  One of the few restaurants in the area with a special late lunch menu.  They also have an excellent craft beer selection available.

data.title: Don't get the salad.
data.text: I think I ordered the wrong thing. The Bounty salad was kind of horrible. The dressing didn't work with the berries. I would go back but I would definitely change my order.

owner_response.author: HockeyChef, Owner at Bourbon, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
So sorry you didn't like the dressing on the salad. If you'd email us your address, we'll get a gift card in the mail for your next visit. We'd love to make it up to you. I'll also let the chef know about the poor pairing. Sometimes, they simply don't check to see if the dressing will work with the seasonal berry. Thanks for taking the time to let us know. Email us your address to kristian@bourboncolumbia.com

Thanks!

Kristian Niemi
Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice spot and good wine
data.text:
I had dinner here with my pooch. I had a salad which was fantastic, strawberries and blueberries with a vinaigrette. I was afraid that it would be sweet, but it wasn't, it was just yummy.  I also had the vegetarian gumbo with grilled shrimp. The gumbo is served with rice but needs some help in the flavoring department, the shrimp were flavored nicely. I had to ask for salt, pepper and hot sauce. It had nice veggies and a good base, just needed a little flavor.

I sat outside, there are several tables and the service was perfect. The wine selection is small, but I was told all of the wines were great and my Pinot was really good- a Russian River selection. 

Would go here again, the menu looked nice, not a huge selection but I got the impression they pay attention to detail.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: Was traveling through Columbia seen this place on trip advisory and thought we would give it a try..Got there about 445 they open at 430.. Waitress got us seated and let us know dinner wouldnt start til 5..she took our order and put it in as soon as kitchen opened. It was definitely worth waiting for. We had the boudain balls crab and artichoke spread and the etouffe.wnted to try the collards but we had already ordered plenty. The boudain actually was served on collard so that was a plus.Everything was great. Service was fast. We will  stop again when  traveling through.

data.title: We had fun & a great meal!
data.text:
We went after the USC game rescheduled to Sunday and the place was jumping. 

Soon got seated. Good service and great food. Enjoyed it sufficiently to go back again this week.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Dang! This is some good food y'all. A little on the pricier side but worth it. I got the steak and my husband got the quail. We were both very pleased. They have a great variety of drinks as well. I would also recommend "Frankly, my dear" drink. If you want to take your bar game up a notch, check out this place. However, I would recommend small groups, the seating was limited but great service.

data.title: Noisy, crowded, best for bourbon
data.text:
There is no doubt about the popularity of this bar, specializing in bourbon and whiskey. Reservations are not accepted so just take your chances. On the weeknight we were there it was very full, but we got the last places by the bar. The noise level was quite high.

I sympathize with the stressed staff, as they kept sprinting inside the counter to keep up.  The food was OK. It is not a wine bar, so don't expect a great deal of a choice by the glass. But they excel in bourbon!

data.title: Excellent bar, food and service
data.text: Sat at the bar and was helped by Amy.  She is a rock star.  Very attentive, helpful and a great bartender.  Her food and drink recommendations were spot on.  Had the boudin balls for an app, duck confit gumbo for a main.  Along with the crispy brussels.  The French Fashioned was a great drink choice.  Great atmosphere.

data.title: Fantastic, Intimate , Great Food
data.text:
This is a fairly new restaurant here in Columbia but already has a great reputation.  
I came here for lunch with co-workers. The  others had salad but I had the chicken with mashed potatoes, gravy, and collard greens. THE BEST DARN COLLARDS I HAVE EVER TASTED. 
Now, I am not southern and I don't have an old family recipe handed down, but these were delicious. Perfectly cooked. 
The chicken breast was crispy but not greasy. The mashed potatoes fluffy. 
My companions ate every bite. 

Will definitely be coming back.

data.title: An amazing bar
data.text: Met my (Seattle) son for a late night drink here, his suggestion as he knows Columbia better that this Hilton Head Island guy... An amazingly well stocked bar with an inviting atmosphere and friendly people... A shout out to Kat, the bar manager for her hospitality... I understand why my son stops here every time he is in Columbia...

data.title: Bourbon not just a drink
data.text: Our waiter Randy was phenomenal.  We arrived at late lunch and threatened to leave because of the limited menu.  Big mistake!  Randy our handsome waiter provided us with information concerning the entrées and made dining a wonderful experience. We will definitely return when we're passing through

data.title: A NOLA experience in COLA
data.text: This place is a great take on New Orleans cuisine right on Main St in Columbia. I have been twice, once not long after they opened, and another time this past weekend. This past time was just as good as the first but less crowded. The food is fantastic but the cocktails are where they really shine. Bar staff is knowledgeable and will make you a great drink based on your preferences. Highly recommend Bourbon.

data.title: I'm actually from Louisiana...
data.text:
I have never been to a Cajun restaurant outside of Louisiana that did it RIGHT! This place breaks the mold. Our server was precious.... Our drinks were made to perfection... And the food was incredible! EAT HERE NO QUESTION

we had...
Bbq shrimp
Hushpups
Pickle jar
Pimento mac
Brussel sprouts
Crab artichoke spread
Black eyed hummus

Hurricane
Old fashioned
Whiskey smash

And bonus... It's reasonably priced! Ugh I wish I could take this place with me! FAB!

owner_response.author: HockeyChef, Owner at Bourbon, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you SO MUCH! We spent a lot of time in and around your beautiful state and we take our role as purveyors of your cuisine very seriously. We're so happy you enjoyed your visit!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Weekday lunch!
data.text: We were looking for a place for lunch and found this place on TA.  The gumbo is hearty and flavourful and the pecan tart was delicious, limited menu for lunch but would love to come back for dinner!  Excellent customer service, we thought the temp of our gumbo was lukewarm and the manager served the fresh batch to us herself and gave us a free dessert for the inconvenience - would go back in a heartbeat!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Excellent atmosphere and great food. Loved the jalapeño hush puppies and the banana parfait. The shrimp etouffe with Tasso sausage was good but a little too much like chili. Shrimp in it were nice size. Lots of sausage in it. Stuffed Quail was great. Next time we will order several appetizers and several desserts. Hurricane is good but not at all like one on bourbon street. It's made with different alcohols. Fine, just not what I expected. Drinks are nice and strong.

data.title: Special upbeat atmosphere
data.text: Noisy, fun ambiance.  Food excellent, service satisfactory.  Red snapper outstanding.  Crowded, loud, pricey.  Can't wait til it gets cooler so can eat outside where there might be more elbow room.  Loved the energy, however.

data.title: Great bar for grown ups
data.text: Had a wonderful experience on our recent visit while celebrating our anniversary. The bar tenders Cat and Logan are artists and very personable. Only had appetizers but were excellent. Nice atmosphere and look forward to returning.

data.title: Hands down, best place in Columbia SC
data.text: One of the best selections of bourbon in the South.  Awesome menu.  I eat here often.  The food is rich but the servings are not huge so you don't feel like you have stuffed yourself.
